definition: to take up one's post/to be given a job
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.chinese: 這個新興的都市上崗的機會很多。

sentences.english: Competition for head nurse position starts a new system for nursery.
sentences.chinese: 護士長競爭上崗，掀開了護理用人制度新的一頁。

sentences.english: The establishment of Yongjin Group offered thousands of laid- off workers new positions.
sentences.chinese: 永進集團創立大會使原下崗工人自此重新上崗。

sentences.english: Seventh, consider revising to reform the personnel system, a system of full employment, through competition.
sentences.chinese: 推進人事制度改革，實行全員聘用制，競爭上崗。

sentences.english: Crewmembers without certificates of competency or other equivalent documents shall be prohibited from serving onboard.
sentences.chinese: 嚴禁未取得適任證書或者其他適任證件的船員上崗。

sentences.english: Therefore, it returns to the topic of I just said "competitive duty".
sentences.chinese: 因此，這又返回到我剛纔的話題“競爭上崗”。

sentences.english: Be living in the technique, Personnel staff after short-term cultivate to go on duty.
sentences.chinese: 在技術上，人員經短期培訓就能上崗。

sentences.english: Did the department manager arrange someone to guide you on your first work day?
sentences.chinese: 在你上崗第一天，部門經理是否爲你安排專人帶班？

sentences.english: If he is fired, he'll be employed again very quickly.
sentences.chinese: 如果他被炒了，他也會很快重新上崗。

sentences.english: Laborers to be engaged in technical work must receive pre-job training before taking up their posts.
sentences.chinese: 從事技術工種的勞動者，上崗前必須經過培訓。

sentences.english: Private schools: Teachers in private schools may not be required to have certification.
sentences.chinese: 公立學校老師必須有教師證才能上崗。
